xhochy commented on issue #2252: ARROW-2553: [Python] Set MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET in wheel build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2252#issuecomment-404480681
 
 
   The wheels don't work:
   
   ```
   ImportError: dlopen(…/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyarrow/lib.so, 2): Library not loaded: libarrow_boost_system.dylib
     Referenced from: …/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyarrow/libarrow.10.dylib
     Reason: image not found
   ```
   
   Seems like we don't  bundle Boost correctly.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on issue #2252: ARROW-2553: [Python] Set MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET in wheel build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2252#issuecomment-404483074
 
 
   The content of the `pyarrow` folder in the virtualenv is:
   
   ```
   pyarrow/libarrow.10.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_filesystem.1.65.1.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_filesystem.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_regex.1.65.1.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_regex.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_system.1.65.1.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_boost_system.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_python.10.dylib
   pyarrow/libarrow_python.dylib
   pyarrow/libparquet.1.4.1.dylib
   pyarrow/libparquet.1.dylib
   pyarrow/libparquet.dylib
   pyarrow/libplasma.10.dylib
   pyarrow/libplasma.dylib
   ```
   
   The library is in there, so this is an RPATH problem.

xhochy commented on issue #2252: ARROW-2553: [Python] Set MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET in wheel build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2252#issuecomment-404853156
 
 
   The auditwheel issue is down to auditwheel now also scanning non-Python binaries: https://github.com/pypa/auditwheel/commit/221d6b1927f660aa4de967a2ee2d55e8dba22744
   
   Looking into this if we might be able to also just fix them to make `auditwheel` pass. Otherwise I'll raise an issue and pin the version while fixing it.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2252#issuecomment-404856640
 
 
   The issue is `libparquet.so`:
   
   ```
   [root@cb5afc24289f pyarrow]# ldd libparquet.so
   	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffdccbb2000)
   	libarrow.so.10 => not found
   	libarrow_boost_regex.so.1.66.0 => not found
   	libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f534f502000)
   	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007f534f27f000)
   	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f534f071000)
   	libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007f534ed18000)
   	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f534fbb1000)
   ```

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: The current `pyarrow` wheels are not usable on older OSX releases due to a problem in the newest Xcode SDK. We need to set {{MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET}} to an older OSX release to avoid getting {{Symbol not found: _os_unfair_lock_lock}}.

comments.body: Should setting it to 10.9 be sufficient?

Would it be enough to set `export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9` in the [wheel osx build|https://github.com/kszucs/arrow/blob/eb06a0d0e051ecaa363b0c965d5a75999194d449/dev/tasks/python-wheels/travis.osx.yml#L25]?

[~kszucs] yes -- I would just go ahead and do this and check that the wheel builds still work. This is consistent with the way that conda-forge is building: https://github.com/conda-forge/toolchain-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/activate.sh#L8
[~wesmckinn] Uwe has already checked, doesn't work properly yet - see the PR.
Sorry -- I had commented on the PR. If we fix the wheels there, then ARROW-2326 will probably be fixed
